column1: The holiday season is upon us & brings many exciting opportunities to gather & celebrate with family & friends. During the holidays it’s important to remember #COVID19 continues to progress among our communities. Read more from my Weekly Column via @yhn: https://t.co/NgNLRCycjN

#COVID19 jeopardizes decades of progress & U.S. investment in global child health & survival. We must work together to make sure gains made are not lost. This #ChildHealthWeek let’s pave a new & better way forward for children everywhere.
Tune in here shortly to get the latest on #COVID19 from @GovernorKayIvey & @ALPublicHealth: https://t.co/5Pch4211kS

I'm honored to be recognized as a 2020 "Guardian of Small Business." Now especially as we combat the effects of the Coronavirus pandemic we must continue to support our small businesses. Thank you @NFIB for this great recognition! https://t.co/uOQugbvBT0

Earlier this month we celebrated World Teachers' Day. As students have learned to adapt to new methods of schooling as a result of the Coronavirus pandemic teachers have worked overtime to ensure students continue to receive a proper & meaningful education.

While we continue to navigate the ongoing Coronavirus pandemic during flu season it’s important to take extra steps in order to stay healthy & well this fall. Read more from my Weekly Column via @yhn: https://t.co/2h9X2yMKHw
Tune in shortly for an update from @GovernorKayIvey on the state’s response to the coronavirus pandemic. Watch live in 15 minutes below: https://t.co/qcBfBJTotK

.@USDA's Farm Service Agency is now accepting applications through Dec. 11 for CFAP 2 which provides direct assistance to American farmers & producers impacted by #COVID19. @usdafsa will host a webinar Thursday to provide more details. Learn more here: https://t.co/CidCkIpnuk

As we continue to celebrate National Truck Driver Appreciation Week I'd like to say THANK YOU to all the drivers who work tirelessly to deliver goods & resources across the country especially during the Coronavirus pandemic! #ThankATrucker https://t.co/ukK8BnJVnV
Tune in shortly to hear from @GovernorKayIvey & state public health officials regarding the latest information on #COVID19 in Alabama. https://t.co/oQSBSyGwNK

Great news in #AL02! The U.S. Economic Development Administration awarded the Southeast Alabama Regional Planning & Development Commission @SEARPDC a $1.89 million grant for Dothan/Houston County to help combat the effects of the Coronavirus pandemic. Thank you @US_EDA!
Tune in soon for a Coronavirus update from Alabama state leaders & officials: https://t.co/XrjEMVrBvD

Several resources are available for Alabamians & small businesses that have been affected by the Coronavirus pandemic. Read more about #COVID19 support from my Weekly Column via @yhn: https://t.co/GdbVHzuZYm
I’m proud to see generous acts of service from businesses & individuals across the Montgomery community & all communities to help in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/UatHm3Inoa

.@GovernorKayIvey today announced excellent news for Alabama small businesses! I'm glad to see the Revive Alabama grant program providing additional federal support through the CARES Act for our local businesses & farms affected by #COVID19. https://t.co/yOMCryDTvM

A new tool is available on @ALPublicHealth’s website to help viewers identify the #COVID19 risk status in each county across the state. Read below for more information on each of the four risk categories: https://t.co/bC70u7KRBr

I urge all Alabamians to take the extended Safer at Home order seriously & practice personal responsibility over the next few weeks in order to protect those in our communities & slow the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/4PfqlJ8gAn

COMING UP: @GovernorKayIvey & state public health officials will provide a #COVID19 update. If you’d like to watch today’s press conference live tune in to your local news station or visit https://t.co/mM3xg9fngR https://t.co/8sWm1CLvGU

Over the past week Alabama has seen the most troubling #COVID19 numbers to date. It’s up to each of us to protect those in our communities by practicing personal responsibility to help slow the spread of the virus. Read more from my Weekly Column via @yhn: https://t.co/OaeYfr87hj

EXCITING NEWS: The Southeast Alabama Regional Planning & Development Commission was awarded a $400000 federal grant to combat the effects of #COVID19. This funding will support redevelopment & revitalization efforts to strengthen our southeastern corner of the State!
#Coronavirus continues to spread across Alabama & remains a threat to our communities. Please continue to follow all implemented guidelines & advice given by our government & public health officials.

Through both health & economic suffering individuals families business leaders & employees have been dramatically impacted by the novel #COVID19 pandemic. Particularly small businesses have been severely affected. Read more from my Weekly Column via @yhn: https://t.co/C19evn8iM1

Patients that have recovered from #COVID19 have antibodies in their immune systems that may be used as a treatment for others. Visit https://t.co/38v9fefZsF to see if you can help by donating plasma. #TheFightIsInUS
🚨🚨Applications are now open for @USDA's Coronavirus Food Assistance Program🚨🚨 Find out more information here: https://t.co/HDTYlNDrmn https://t.co/23sZBZAbBc
Tune in at 2:00pm CT for an update on #COVID19 response efforts throughout the state. Find more information on how to access the video footage below: https://t.co/zAYkibvVwl

GREAT NEWS: @USDA today released details about the support available to American farmers ranchers & producers through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. This program will provide up to $16 billion in direct payments to those farmers impacted by #COVID19. https://t.co/pyuGRFjPH7

Americans have sacrificed & adapted to unfamiliar lifestyle changes to contribute to mitigation practices to slow the spread of #COVID19. While these practices have certainly helped flatten the curve this virus is still very much present. Read more from my Weekly Column via @yhn https://t.co/UjlMWbJfzk

REMINDER: @USDA will host a webinar this afternoon at 1:00pm Eastern for farmers & ranchers interested in applying for support through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Registration is still open here: https://t.co/gVtyU9khwA

Be sure to watch the #HercsOverAlabama today honoring our Alabama #COVID19 frontline heroes & conducted by the @908AW from @MaxwellAFB! Second District cities Montgomery & Troy are both included in the flight path. Events begin at 11:10am. See more information below: https://t.co/BVXvEXQbvm

In light of #COVID19 my plans to return to Afghanistan this year were regrettably cancelled. My prayers remain w/ our military members overseas & all those impacted by #COVID19. Read more from my Weekly Column via @yhn.

Thank you for having us @_GlobalWIN! I enjoyed our productive discussion this morning w/ my colleague & friend @DWStweets about ways in which women & moms have adjusted during #COVID19. https://t.co/GxPynvwRcZ

Be sure to catch the Alabama National Guard’s flyover honoring healthcare workers first responders essential employees & all those serving to support #COVID19 response efforts starting at noon! https://t.co/U2btOsduvd

Don't miss @DannellyField's F-16s fly over hospitals & communities across the state to honor our Alabama heroes working on the frontlines to combat #COVID19. The flyover will take place tomorrow beginning at noon. Please see below for the flight path in Montgomery & Dothan: https://t.co/gTeD4Yfake

Now more than ever it is in the best interest of the people of Alabama & vital to the health & well-being of all Americans that we do not deter our efforts to combat #COVID19. Read more from my Weekly Column via @yhn: https://t.co/HDQdO6TkQA

Thank you @michaelcburgess for taking time to talk w/ hospitals from across Alabama’s Second District! We had a productive discussion about available resources that provide support for our nation’s hospitals facing challenges from #COVID19. https://t.co/jNNaP7TXoJ

Please keep these updates in mind as Alabama transitions today to follow @GovernorKayIvey's "Safer at Home" guidelines. Your participation in this process greatly impacts the state's road to recovery as we continue to combat #COVID19. https://t.co/qDNlesSGxu

Please continue to protect yourself & others by adhering to all guidelines put in place by our government officials. Following proper protocols will help determine how we all progress to fight #COVID19 & the economic impacts it has brought w/ it. Read more from my Weekly Column: https://t.co/qPLiiHyxhh
Thank you to all our healthcare professionals for your dedicated work in the fight against #COVID19! https://t.co/1l6wscpULm
This legislation also provides critical support for our hospitals COVID-19 testing capacities & additional resources in disaster loans for businesses including those in the agriculture sector.
It's important to remember this helpful information from @CDCgov about #COVID19. These facts & tips can help protect yourself & others from infection. https://t.co/xwHi4gzWyt

The Senate just passed the Paycheck Protection Program & Health Care Enhancement Act providing additional relief to combat #COVID19. The House is now prepared to pass this bill bringing support for our hospitals expanding testing capacities & PPP funds for our small businesses.
Please be sure to tune in now to @GovernorKayIvey’s press conference w/ the latest updates on Alabama’s #COVID19 response efforts. https://t.co/ui5yDxsfQz

I'm confident Congress will act this week to replenish the resources that have already been exhausted from the CARES Act including the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). It's imperative for our American small businesses affected by #COVID19 to access to these helpful resources.

.@USDA is providing $19 billion in #COVID19 relief funds supporting our nation‘s farmers & ranchers that face challenges & hardships as a result of this pandemic. Glad to see help on the way for these men & women who work hard to put food on the table for our American families.

It's wonderful to read inspiring stories about people across the Second District coming together to volunteer their efforts to help combat #COVID19. Thank you to all Alabamians who have volunteered in every way to help those in need. https://t.co/uvhTRQTaMX

GOOD NEWS: @GovernorKayIvey just announced a new drive-thru #COVID19 testing site in Montgomery. This site will be available to anyone experiencing symptoms healthcare workers & first responders. More details here: https://t.co/ZgbFYdbqIR

If you feel you should be tested for #COVID19 & are looking for a testing location check out @ALPublicHealth's COVID-19 Data & Surveillance Dashboard. Information on available testing sites across the state is updated here: https://t.co/aDNDG62NZO

For any individuals or businesses w/ extra PPE equipment that are looking for ways to assist during the #COVID19 pandemic - you can learn more about today’s statewide PPE donation day here: https://t.co/pxvHiDECLA

Thanks for having me yesterday @jeff_poor! Great discussion about Alabama's #COVID19 response efforts & how the Second District is doing during this time. Looking forward to talking w/ you again. https://t.co/kScw1YDbZq

This is a great resource for Alabama small businesses w/ #COVID19 questions or concerns. The phone lines are still open until 12:00pm CT w/ professionals who are ready to help! https://t.co/HUOjtT8r7V

This is a great opportunity for small business owners in Alabama that have questions on #COVID19 related programs implemented under the CARES Act. If you are interested join @BCAToday's small business forum tonight at 7:00pm CT on @APTV! https://t.co/2Lil4bwNEG

Here is one example of many in the Second District where Alabamians joined together to provide support during the #COVID19 pandemic. Thanks for sharing this inspiring story @wsfa12news! https://t.co/HitEoVpL2R

Today we recognize the great sacrifice our wonderful doctors nurses researchers public health officials & all healthcare workers make as they work to treat & protect those affected by #COVID19. THANK YOU to all who risk their lives to save the lives of others. #WorldHealthDay https://t.co/1g3xyxxo7z
Visit https://t.co/73fz9VBHvT for all information regarding Alabama's efforts in response to #COVID19.

.@GovernorKayIvey today announced the launch of a new online platform providing assistance for individuals & businesses across Alabama that have been impacted by #COVID19 & for Alabamians who wish to offer aid & support to those affected.
GOOD NEWS: the @SBAgov Paycheck Protection Program is now accepting applications from small businesses impacted by #COVID19. Learn more information here: https://t.co/Uw1Rg4Bpmd

Thank you to all the men & women on the frontlines who continue to serve Americans day in & day out as our nation combats #COVID19. We are grateful for the efforts of our healthcare workers first responders law enforcement delivery drivers grocery workers & many others.

It’s critical for the health & safety of all Alabamians that we do our part & follow guidance from our state & local leaders in order to slow the spread of #COVID19. Read more from my Weekly Column via @yhn: https://t.co/1Jr6CWLRFl

It can be easy for disinformation to circulate as our nation continues to combat the spread of #COVID19. It's critical to get your facts & information from a trusted source during these unprecedented times. Read more from @fema about rumor control here: https://t.co/4BllXQfjVv

Here's a list of #COVID19 screening site locations across #AL02. It’s important to remember @ALPublicHealth’s recommendation to contact your doctor before immediately seeking testing if you think you may be sick. https://t.co/hqKKZC32Sp
To determine if an entity impacted by #COVID19 is eligible for @SBAgov disaster loan fill out this information here: https://t.co/Cz0VPAkMW4

It’s imperative that all Americans - regardless of age - continue to follow the @CDCgov & @WhiteHouse guidelines to slow the spread of #COVID19 over the next 30 days. #DoYourPart https://t.co/PUtNHRV7ai

A special THANK YOU to all of our nation's doctors today as we celebrate #NationalDoctorsDay. Our doctors have a significant impact on individual lives & local communities. Your meaningful work is appreciated by all especially as we continue to combat #COVID19.
As #COVID19 continues to spread across Alabama I remain committed to providing my constituents w/ continuous updates. Read my Weekly Column below:  https://t.co/IWNBPFPrXK
I am pleased the House passed the CARES Act today providing critical support for American families & businesses impacted by #COVID19. Read my full statement below: https://t.co/L5VosPHd4A

REMINDER: Health professionals have stated it's not necessary to immediately seek testing if you are not experiencing symptoms of #COVID19. If you think you may be sick & have symptoms of the virus call your primary care physician before seeking medical care. https://t.co/MlXll57rfU
Listen in shortly for an update from @ALPublicHealth regarding #COVID19 across our state: https://t.co/PCj4ux9dex
GREAT NEWS: Baptist Health has added a second drive-up #COVID19 testing location in Prattville. More information from @wsfa12news here: https://t.co/GqAY25r5uP

Any labs or providers in #AL02 that are having trouble obtaining testing supplies for #COVID19 should call @US_FDA hotline at 1-888-463-6332 which is available 24 hours a day. Local health departments can also call or work w/ state officials to make requests w/ @fema or @PHEgov.
Here is helpful information from @fema on ways Americans & businesses can provide assistance during the #COVID19 outbreak: https://t.co/hT4NGlIw2z
Tune in now for an update from the White House Coronavirus Task Force here: https://t.co/FOe05MUCWt

It’s vitally important to the health of those in our communities across the Second District to practice social distancing during the #COVID19 outbreak. Here are some tips on how from @ALPublicHealth: https://t.co/4iSKu3SX8B
An important update regarding #Coronavirus for my constituents in Alabama: https://t.co/PKMG6eSqUv
Tune in today at 2:00pm CT for an update on the novel #Coronavirus from @ALPublicHealth. Live stream link below: https://t.co/9nEtZWPrX2
The Administration is currently giving an update on the #Coronavirus outbreak. You can listen in here: https://t.co/cbtfJlKOSb

.@GovernorKayIvey just announced Alabama's primary runoff election will now be held on July 14 2020 due to concerns surrounding the #Coronavirus outbreak. This decision is in the best interest of the public health & safety of all Alabamians. https://t.co/eklElgHiSx

.@SBAgov has made available several helpful resources for small businesses that have been severely impacted by the #Coronavirus outbreak. Learn more about how to utilize these tools here: https://t.co/pf8ccyZoN4

Stay updated on all current & future public health emergency orders related to #COVID19 from @ALPublicHealth w/ the link below. This information will be resourceful as we move forward in our response to combat the #Coronavirus outbreak: https://t.co/G2C7Qhuukz https://t.co/7SgJwIanME
The Administration just released new information from @US_FDA regarding #Coronavirus testing to further increase the testing capabilities within state borders: https://t.co/Tmvzc4qVB9
.@al_labor announced yesterday that workers who are unable to work due to the #Coronavirus outbreak are eligible to file for unemployment benefits. https://t.co/Rs5Ms1Ccph
It’s critically important that we all do our part to help slow the spread of #Coronavirus. Here is the latest guidance released from @WhiteHouse & @CDCgov today: https://t.co/H3Qa5eENlg
I remain committed to keeping my constituents informed & up-to-date on any news surrounding the #Coronavirus outbreak.
Any Alabamian who has questions on if how & where to test for #Coronavirus can call @ALPublicHealth’s toll-free hotline starting tomorrow morning at 8:00am CT at 1-888-264-2256.

Please be aware of sites circulating maps that claim to be tracking #Coronavirus cases globally. @HHSGov has warned that some of these sites are infecting devices w/ malware. To keep your information safe double check all sources & links.
I have compiled helpful guidance & resources for anyone w/ questions or concerns on #Coronavirus & you can read more about this ongoing situation in my Weekly Column: https://t.co/hfiUFSnQBg

The President just declared a national emergency to combat #Coronavirus. As our country moves forward w/ addressing challenges associated w/ #Coronavirus it's incumbent upon my office to provide the people of the Second District w/ the most recent information on the outbreak.

I have added a feature to my website https://t.co/pGDyJjacCQ to ensure my constituents in the Second District can easily stay up-to-date w/ the latest information from @CDCgov on the #Coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/kCMqHXhD7p
.⁦⁦@StateDept⁩ advises U.S. citizens to reconsider travel abroad due to the #Coronavirus outbreak. Read more from the State Department here:  https://t.co/A9xfTxsHao

I remain engaged w/ the latest information on the #Coronavirus & next steps Congress may take regarding the outbreak. Remember to follow @CDCgov steps to help prevent the spread of germs & familiarize yourself w/ symptoms of the virus. https://t.co/04jF8GsRtf

As we continue to monitor & learn more about the #Coronavirus outbreak it's critically important to stay up-to-date with the latest information from @CDCgov and @ALPublicHealth. https://t.co/daVYWzlVNQ

The House just passed legislation providing emergency funding to combat the #Coronavirus outbreak. This funding will give state & local governments the resources needed to fight against the virus. I remain committed to keeping my constituents informed & up to date on this issue.

Today I attended a House Member's briefing on the #Coronavirus outbreak. It's extremely important we all take proper precautions to stay healthy & well especially as we are in the midst of flu season. Click below for more information & best practices from @CDCgov: https://t.co/YD9MoyXiNn
